hu.elte.txtuml.api

Enum ModelClass.Status

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ModelClass.Status>
      • hu.elte.txtuml.api.ModelClass.Status
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ModelClass.Status>
    Enclosing class:
    ModelClass

    public static enum ModelClass.Status
extends java.lang.Enum<ModelClass.Status>
    The life cycle of a model object consists of steps represented by the constants of this enumeration type.

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    See Also:
    READY, ACTIVE, FINALIZED, DELETED

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ACTIVE
      This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object's state machine is currently running.
      DELETED
      This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object is deleted.
      FINALIZED
      This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object either has no state machine or its state machine is already stopped but the object itself is not yet deleted from the model.
      READY
      This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object's state machine is not yet started.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • READY

        public static final ModelClass.Status READY
        This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object's state machine is not yet started. It will not react to any asynchronous events, for example, sending signals to it. However, sending signal to a READY object is legal in the model, therefore no error or warning messages are shown if it is done.

        See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

        See Also:
        ACTIVE

      • ACTIVE

        public static final ModelClass.Status ACTIVE
        This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object's state machine is currently running.

        It may be reached by starting the state machine of this object manually with the Action.start(ModelClass) method.

        See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

      • FINALIZED

        public static final ModelClass.Status FINALIZED
        This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object either has no state machine or its state machine is already stopped but the object itself is not yet deleted from the model. Its fields and methods might be used but it will not react to any asynchronous events, for example, sending signals to it. However, sending signal to a FINALIZED object is legal in the model, therefore no error or warning messages are shown if it is done.

        Note: currently there is no way to stop the state machine of a model object without deleting it. So the only way to reach this status is to implement a model class without a state machine.

        See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

      • DELETED

        public static final ModelClass.Status DELETED
        This status of a ModelClass object indicates that the represented model object is deleted. No further use of this object is allowed, however, using its fields or methods do not result in any error messages because of the limitations of the Java language.

        An object may only be in this status when all of its associations are unlinked and its state machine is stopped.

        See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

        See Also:
        Action.delete(ModelClass)

    System.out.println(c);
